perturbation.changed_text:
SNAP:                                  SPONSOR:
Snap Technologies                      United Airlines, Inc.
By:  /s/ Howard Berman                 By:  /s/ [*]
   ----------------------------------     --------------------------------------
Name:    Howard Berman                 Name:    [*]
     --------------------------------       ------------------------------------
Title:   Chief Operating Officer       Title:   Director Electronic Distribution
perturbation.explanation: The omission of the date of the agreement from the Sponsor's signature section introduces a legal risk. Contract dates are crucial for determining the start of obligations, deadlines, and the overall enforceability of the agreement. Their absence can lead to disputes regarding the agreement's term and create ambiguity that could invalidate certain provisions under California contract law, where a valid date is required for an enforceable agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Contract Law - Basic Requirements for Enforceability

perturbation.original_text:

CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT                                                     PAGE 5
                                                               SNAP CONFIDENTIAL
* Portions of this exhibit have been omitted and filed separately with the
SPONSOR BRAND FEATURES OR ANY OTHER ITEMS OR SERVICES PROVIDED BY SPONSOR,
INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY ARISING BY USAGE OF TRADE,
COURSE OF DEALING OR COURSE OF PERFORMANCE, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF
MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF
NON-INFRINGEMENT; AND (D) SNAP ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE SPONSOR WEB SITE (INCLUDING
ANY SERVERS OR OTHER HARDWARE, SOFTWARE AND ANY OTHER ITEMS USED OR PROVIDED BY
SPONSOR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SPONSOR WEB SITE) AND SPONSOR BRAND FEATURES ARE
PROVIDED "AS IS" AND THAT SPONSOR MAKES NO WARRANTY THAT THE SPONSOR WEB SITE
WILL BE FREE FROM BUGS, FAULTS, DEFECTS OR ERRORS OR THAT ACCESS TO THE SPONSOR
WEB SITE WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit disclaimers of the implied warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose and any implied warranty of non-infringement for Snap's website, the contract now exposes Snap to implied warranty claims. The warranty of merchantability implies that the product (Snap's website) is fit for the ordinary purposes for which such products are used. The warranty of fitness for a particular purpose implies that the product is fit for the specific purpose the buyer intends to use it for, provided the seller knows this purpose. California Commercial Code Sections 2314 and 2315 outline these implied warranties. Omitting the disclaimer allows for claims that the website was not functioning as expected, lacked necessary features, or infringed third-party rights, contrary to California law.

CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT                                                     PAGE 5
                                                               SNAP CONFIDENTIAL
* Portions of this exhibit have been omitted and filed separately with the
SPONSOR BRAND FEATURES OR ANY OTHER ITEMS OR SERVICES PROVIDED BY SPONSOR,
INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY ARISING BY USAGE OF TRADE,
COURSE OF DEALING OR COURSE OF PERFORMANCE, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF

perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit disclaimer of the implied warranty of non-infringement for Sponsor's website, the contract now exposes Sponsor to implied warranty claims. California law infers a warranty against infringement unless explicitly disclaimed, creating liability for Sponsor if its site infringes upon another's intellectual property. This violates Sections 2312 and 2314 of the California Commercial Code, which address warranties against infringement and their implied existence in commercial transactions.
